channel.title: Does anyone know how to make a server read item value
channel.description:
Im developing a minigame similar to pvp worlds, bounty hunter, and the wilderness and i ask of assistance as to how the server can read itemvalue.With this, i can make i so whatever your worth, you will get a better drop since you are risking items.This is an example void i created tho there has been errors.
[code] public void pvPDrops() { if(combatLevel >= 3 && combatLevel <= 50 && (int)Math.floor(GetItemValue(playerItems[i]-1) >= 200000)) { addItem(Item.randomPvP(), 1); } }[/code]
Error that came with this
[code]:: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_07 :: Results: client.java:18: floor(double) in java.lang.Math cannot be applied to (boolean) if(combatLevel >= 3 && combatLevel <= 50 && (int)Math.floor(GetI temValue(playerItems[i]-1) >= 200000)) { ^ client.java:18: operator && cannot be applied to boolean,int if(combatLevel >= 3 && combatLevel <= 50 && (int)Math.floor(GetI temValue(playerItems[i]-1) >= 200000)) { ^ 2 errors :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Does anyone know how to make a server read item value
item.dc:creator: @dontreadthis dontreadthis
item.description:
@dontreadthis wrote:

Im developing a minigame similar to pvp worlds, bounty hunter, and the wilderness and i ask of assistance as to how the server can read itemvalue.With this, i can make i so whatever your worth, you will get a better drop since you are risking items.This is an example void i created tho there has been errors.

public void pvPDrops() { if(combatLevel >= 3 && combatLevel <= 50 && (int)Math.floor(GetItemValue(playerItems[i]-1) >= 200000)) { addItem(Item.randomPvP(), 1); } }

Error that came with this

:: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_07 :: Results: client.java:18: floor(double) in java.lang.Math cannot be applied to (boolean) if(combatLevel >= 3 && combatLevel <= 50 && (int)Math.floor(GetI temValue(playerItems[i]-1) >= 200000)) { ^ client.java:18: operator && cannot be applied to boolean,int if(combatLevel >= 3 && combatLevel <= 50 && (int)Math.floor(GetI temValue(playerItems[i]-1) >= 200000)) { ^ 2 errors :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .
